intro: Athroandra angolensis, commonly known as the Angola hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Athroandra angolensis is adapted to thrive in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or riverine habitats.
